modal-import-products.something-went-wrong: Something went wrong with the rows from
modal-import-products.title: Import Product catalog
modal-import-products.description: When you import a product catalog, a zero inventory is automatically created for all your locations if a product does not already exist. If the product does exists, it will be updated. Any new product groups specified will also be created automatically.
modal-import-products.import-criteria: Your import file must meet certain criteria before it can be uploaded. Please refer to the example file to see the structure.
modal-import-products.unsure-look-faq: If you are still unsure about the format of the file, please look at our FAQ on
modal-import-products.faq-link: How do I format my import file to the product catalog?
modal-import-products.file-import-example: See how the file should be structured
modal-import-products.drag-and-drop: Drag and drop the file here
modal-import-products.drag-and-drop2: Drag and drop the file here, or click to select
modal-import-products.import-completed-description: Import of your product catalog is now completed.

faq-page.question-user-roles: What can the users roles do?
faq-page.user-roles-description: The user roles are divided into five levels, each with different permissions. They are distributed as follows:
faq-page.role-admin-description: is the highest user role on a customer account and has access to all features, data related to inventory, and user management.
faq-page.role-moderator-description: is the second-highest user role, with the same permissions as an administrator but only at assigned locations.
faq-page.role-user-description: is the regular day-to-day user with access to inventory management functions. This role can be further limited by platform access and whether prices may be displayed.
faq-page.role-departure-description: is for limited inventory management on the warehouse floor, where users only need access to the app to process departures.
faq-page.role-readonly-description: is for very limited access to only viewing the overview and history. This role is limited to the web platform.
faq-page.question-format-import: How do I format my import file to the product catalog?
faq-page.title: Frequently asked questions
faq-page.description: Here you can find answers to the most common asked questions about Nem Lager
faq-page.to-import: To be able to import a file to update your product catalog, the file must meet these criteria.
faq-page.table-data: The table data must be structured in no particular order and contain values that match the list below.
faq-page.product-no-criteria: can contain both numbers and letters
faq-page.barcode-criteria: can contain both numbers and letters
faq-page.product-group-criteria: can contain both numbers and letters
faq-page.unit-criteria: must be written as they appear on the product cards. Case sensitivity is not taken into account. E.g., Stk or stk.
faq-page.unit-criteria3: Kasse - Kg - Stk - Gram - Pose - Plade - Meter - Liter - Ark - Rulle - Pakke - M2 - Palle - Sæt.
faq-page.sub1: To correctly import or update a product catalog, the import file must meet certain requirements. If the file does not comply with these, the import will not work.
faq-page.sub-list-li-1: Columns with text or pre-filled values must be completed
faq-page.sub-list-li-2: – these are necessary for the system to process the file correctly.
faq-page.sub-list-li-4: – you don’t need to fill them in, but you can if you want to add extra information.
faq-page.sub3: Below, we go through each column in the template – here we explain what they mean, what they can contain, and what requirements apply to them.
faq-page.text1-criteria: must not contain only numbers. E.g., 34567 must have at least one letter.
faq-page.text2-3-criteria: It is optional to fill out these fields. If used, the same requirements apply as for Product Text 1.
faq-page.text2-criteria: must not contain only numbers. E.g., 34567 must have at least one letter. Is optional.
faq-page.text3-criteria: must not contain only numbers. E.g., 34567 must have at least one letter. Is optional.
faq-page.cost-price-criteria: must be separated with a comma (,) for decimals. A thousand separator can be used with a period (.) but is not required.
faq-page.sales-price-criteria: must be separated with a comma (,) for decimals. A thousand separator can be used with a period (.) but is not required.
faq-page.barred-criteria: must be written as either true, false, yes, or no. Truthy values are true and yes. Falsy values are false and no.
faq-page.minimum-criteria: can be omitted. If included, decimals should be separated by a comma (,). A thousand separator can be used with a period (.) but is not required.
faq-page.maximum-criteria: can be omitted. If included, decimals should be separated by a comma (,). A thousand separator can be used with a period (.) but is not required.
faq-page.order-amount-criteria: can be omitted. If included, decimals should be separated by a comma (,). A thousand separator can be used with a period (.) but is not required.

cron-mails.question: Which scheduled emails can I receive?
cron-mails.sub: Easy Warehouse offers the following list of emails that can be sent to either internal users or external emails:
cron-mails.stock-value-answer: Receive an Excel sheet and a PDF with a summary of the warehouse value – broken down by both products and product groups. The material is summarized and ready for further work. The email is sent automatically on the last day of each month.
cron-mails.restock-answer: When the first product with a specified minimum stock falls below the threshold, you will automatically receive an email with an overview of products that need to be reordered. Note: The email is only sent when the list goes from empty to at least one product below the minimum – not with every single change. You will receive a new email once the reorder list is cleared and meets the criteria again.
cron-mails.movements-answer: An email is sent to the user who has registered the pickup of products from the warehouse. The email contains an overview of which products and how many units the user has taken – so you have full insight into your own movements.

app-signout.question: When are my users signed out of the app?
app-signout.sub: In the Nem Lager app, your users can be signed out if one of the following scenarios occurs:
app-signout.li-desc_screen: If the screen on the scanner goes to sleep while the app is open, the user will be signed out. The time before the screen goes to sleep can be configured on the scanner via the "Settings" app.
app-signout.li-desc_background: If the Nem Lager app is in the background for an extended period, the user will be signed out. This could happen, for example, when using other apps. The duration before the user is signed out can be configured from the Nem Lager website via the [Administration] -> [Company] menu.

restock-setup.question: How do I use Restock?
restock-setup.sub: Reorder only shows the product numbers that have a minimum stock quantity specified.
restock-setup.methods: You can add a recommended quantity either directly from the product page by clicking the reorder icon "+", or via the import file.
restock-setup.watch-how: Want to see how? In the video below, we walk you through the process step by step.

delete-sku.question: How do I delete an item number?
delete-sku.sub: In NemLager you have two options if an item number is no longer needed:
delete-sku.option1-sub: When you delete an item, it is permanently removed from your account. It cannot be searched for or restored later. This option should only be used if you are absolutely sure the item will never be needed again.
delete-sku.option2-sub: When you block an item, it remains in the system but is marked as inactive. You can easily filter out blocked items by selecting the filter 'Status' → 'Active'. The advantage of this solution is that the block can be lifted if the item becomes relevant again later.
delete-sku.tip-txt: If you are unsure, we recommend blocking the item instead of deleting it.
delete-sku.steps-delete-2: Find the item you want to delete
delete-sku.steps-delete-3: Click on the three dots (…) on the far right of the row
delete-sku.steps-delete-4: Click 'Delete item' and confirm the action
delete-sku.steps-block-2: Find the item you want to block
delete-sku.steps-block-3: Click on the three dots (…) on the far right of the row
delete-sku.steps-block-4: Click 'Block item' – the item will immediately be marked as blocked and disappear from the overview unless you have enabled the filter 'Status' → 'Blocked'.

suppliers.question: Suppliers
suppliers.sub: Here you can create and manage suppliers, so they can be linked to your items.
suppliers.intro: With this feature, you can link your primary supplier to an item number. At the same time, you can add contact details such as customer number, name, phone, and email, so you always have the most important information gathered in one place. This makes the ordering process faster, more efficient, and gives you a clear overview of where your products come from.
suppliers.benefit-1: Filter products by supplier in overview and history.
suppliers.benefit-2: Make reordering easier by linking supplier data to the item number.
suppliers.benefit-3: Keep track of important information such as customer number, contact person, phone, and email.
suppliers.benefit-4: Create a complete overview of all your suppliers in one place.
suppliers.steps-3: Click the plus icon (+) in the top right corner.
suppliers.steps-4: Enter details such as supplier name, country, and any contact information.
suppliers.steps-link-title: How to link a supplier to an item number
suppliers.steps-link-2: Open the product you want to link a supplier to.
suppliers.steps-link-3: Click the 'Edit' button in the top right corner.
suppliers.steps-link-4: Select the supplier in the 'Supplier' field.
suppliers.steps-link-5: Save the changes – the product is now linked to the supplier.
suppliers.tip-txt: We recommend adding both contact person, phone, and email, so you always have the necessary information at hand when ordering products.

locations-vs-placements.question: What is the difference between Location and Placement?
locations-vs-placements.sub: Locations and placements are used differently in NemLager and are important to distinguish between.
locations-vs-placements.location: A location is a physical address or department where inventory is kept separate from other locations.
locations-vs-placements.placement: A placement, on the other hand, is a specific spot within a location, e.g., a shelf or rack, where the item is stored.
locations-vs-placements.role-admin-txt: Can see all locations and their inventory.
locations-vs-placements.role-moderator-txt: Can view and manage their assigned location.
locations-vs-placements.role-other-txt: Can view data and perform stock movements on their assigned locations.
